column11: Review Text

column8: This place is filled with a variety of local and exotic birds and fish.
column11: place where you can go to see fish and birds in one place is the Water World in the Kelaniya area. This place is filled with a variety of local and exotic birds and fish. This place, which attracts special attention from young children, is also suitable for adults. The park is divided into four sections: Sea World, Bird Park, Underwater Tunnel, and River  Safari . There is a restaurant where you can buy food and drinks and you can get lunch from there. The weak point I saw here is that the amount of underwater space is very small and the path for electricity to travel through it is not working properly. The highlight of the here is the small boat ride that is offered to us. If you're looking for a place to go to entertain your child during the holidays, this is a great place to do it.

column8: IMPROVE THE PLACE TO BE A WONDER OF SRI LANKA
column11: I was happy to see something like this in Sri Lanka but sad to say that the place doesn't seem to be properly maintained. This lacks cleanliness and to see that the property is not maintained properly. People have literd the place and the gardens could be landscaped and planted with tropical plants that grow without much caring, seating could be arranged nicely, more bins to be kept in the gardens. The seats were all dirty never washed even the place doesn't seem to be swept and well kept. Actually to bring this type of places to a foreign standard only a little is necessary to be done. The upkeep must be high then the ticket price should be raised at least to 1500 for adults and 750 for a child. Sri Lanka has to think ahead not to be where we are today. Just a matter of improvement which could make this place into a wonder.

One of the biggest aquariums in Sri Lanka. They had various kinds of fish and animals in this park. You can see a lot of birds in the birds park. Usually a busy place and not much parking space in this area. They have an under water tunnel, but actually a much shorter one than I thought. It's not a fair experience. But they have a river safari that went through different kinds of animals and it was like an adventure tour. You can contribute to feed the birds and it would be a lovely experience. Fair ticket rates and you can earn a nice experience. Toilets available. Good for kids.

Visited Water World recently,  The Christmas decorations were absolutely magical, adding a festive touch to the incredible underwater tunnel and exhibits. The river safari ride was a true adventure‚Äîspotting the tribal man amidst the lush surroundings made it even more exciting. A perfect blend of nature, wildlife, and holiday cheer! Highly recommend for families and nature enthusiasts alike!

I recently visited Water World Kelaniya, and it was an unforgettable experience! The underwater tunnel was absolutely mesmerizing ‚Äì walking through it felt like being transported into the heart of the ocean. The variety of marine life on display was stunning, and the aquariums were well-maintained. The bird park was another highlight, with a beautiful collection of exotic birds in a serene environment. The whole place is perfect for families, nature lovers, or anyone looking for a peaceful and educational outing. Highly recommend visiting if you‚Äôre near Colombo ‚Äì it‚Äôs a unique attraction that truly stands out in Sri Lanka!
Nice place to visit with family.beautiful fish aquarium more than hundered of sea fish variety. Beautiful birds and boat ride.

column8: Newly opened River Safari - A world class attraction
column11: Amazing place! can recommend it to all ages, specially for families. The place had so many species of fish, probably 500+ species and impressive collection of birds. Very friendly staff, free parking, free bird feeding, free fish feeding, so many interesting activities that were all given free of charge.  Fish and birds look well taken care of. Spacious tanks and cages that were clean and very well maintained. For a aquatic fan, there were lots of information boards. The best attraction was the newly opened River Safari. This was a world class theme ride, and very unique. The cafeteria needs improvement as they did not serve lunch. All in all a great experience. Highly recommended.
Bird experience is fair but could have made it better. Bathroom need to be more clean and easy accessible. And some of the birds need to be kept more clean environment

Amazing place with lots of species of fish and birds. Fish looked healthy and matured. Clean and large bird cages, birds were active and looked well taken care of. Lots of trees, maybe the most green attraction in Colombo! Good for kids and adults alike. They can improve the cafeteria. Staff were friendly and helpful. They also have free bird feeding, free fish feeding and diving shows. The best attraction was the newly opened River Safari. It was a new experience filled with beautiful natural scapes, plants, fish and free flying birds. The River safari bird cages were huge! Maybe 100 feet long and 20+ feet tall. It was a treat to watch them so free. Highly recommend this place for all.
Can provide better conditions for animals. The birds looked miserable. It doesn't look humane how they have trapped starks in a tiny cage without even water. Cages can improve.

Visited Water World last week and it was breathtaking. Amazing array of Fishes.Under Water Tunnel was magnificent as surprisingly long.The bird cages were big and most birds were freely roaming.You could see the birds were enjoying their cages.The tunnel is relatively long but you can't expect it to be huge considering the ticket fee!!In Singapore prices of each ticket exceed Rs.5000.Here it is only 350.Amazing and totally worth the cost.

the worst aquarium and bird zoo we have ever seen. the animals, especially the birds, are held in absolutely unbelievably small cages, even the big ones - sometimes up to 10 big birds in a cage so small, they can hardly open their wings! birds who should be able to fly like cranichs, are held 4 in one cage, desperately trying to fly but the roof is very low and the cage extremely small... so when one opes his wings, the other cannot. same story with all the others! how they hold theirs animals is a real nightmare. and the tunnel? maybe 6m long or something, then over. the pictures of the tunnel are not what it looks like in reality. they make it look bigger and longer on the fotos, but it is a thing of 1 minute to watch and pass through. the childrens playground was dirty, the handwashing station there was broken, as well as one of the toilets was flooding everything because it was broken. no one cared, no one fixed it even after we told them that something is broken. no interest at all. do not support this thing called "water world". it's "water hell" for most of the animals there, especially the  birds. i have never seen a zoo or aquarium holding it's animals in such small cages and areas. a real nightmare.

one of the best aquarium and birds park. largest number of fishes. under the fish name written explanation of that fish or something. I went there after two years lots of changes, birds park fully opened there is lots of birds items. I went there on Saturday so much of rush of people, so avoid going on weekends. ticket price for adults for 320LKR for Sri Lankan (270LKR for Aquarium 50LKR for Birds) best place for kids and adults because its mind relaxing can learn new things. small parking area for parking. underwater tunnel's elevator not working this time don't know why. there is lots of birds there white peacocks and regular peacocks different verity of birds etc. sounds of birds and sounds of water mesmerizing.

There are a large number of beautiful sea creatures to admire in this aquarium plus some exotic birds.  If you plan to go to the piranha feeding you should be on time since they only feed them what looks like one chicken leg. This place was more extensive then I expected it to be and we spent an enjoyable couple of hours here. The kiosk has reasonably priced food too. The main complaint is that the exhibits often bear no resemblance to what is on the sign for the tank. Though on the plus side almost all have an english description. Tourist prices are less then 3x local price, so almost a bargain ;)
Amazing creatures, great music, great sound, interesting descriptions. Don't miss Zungaro fish, play with electric catfish, hand feed the poi.

It's an amazing aquarium, complete with an underwater tunnel. The prices for adult is LKR 350, children above 3, LKR 120.( not really a tourist attraction) We went on a poya day, around midday so it was relatively crowded, and hot. It was  still quite enjoyable. I would recommend to take water and a snack if going with young kids, but they have a shops that sells fast food(noodles, fried rice) n chips,ice cream,drinks etc. It also has a bird park n a play ground. Parking can be difficult on a crowded day, had to park roadside. Takes about 2-3hrs to enjoy the park.

Second place other than national Zoo of Sri  Lanka which has various species of fishes and Birds. Major attention given to Fishes and you can see some rare types too. Specially the first under water tunnel in South Asia and Sri Lanka is an amazing stuff. Though it was a small distance, but allowed Sri Lankan‚Äôs experience the underwater tunnel in an affordable rate. Overall if you time to spend or think to take your kid somewhere better place. Nearly spend about 3 hours... Tickets range for locals Rs. 320/- And nearly Rs.800 for foreigners....
has developed a lot since the beginning. Hope its grows much bigger. good place to spend time with friends.

Interesting place to visit. They have a good collection of fish from different parts of the world from the Amazon etc. Minimum of 2 hrs required. Good for both adults and children and a short drive from Colombo. There is an added section to see different species of birds including Canada Geese.

This place has a wide range of fishes and a bird park as well. You also have the opportunity to go into a underwater tunnel and see them feeding the fish. They also have a bird park which  we could not go due to heavy rain. So it a advisable to see the weather before you go if you want to see both. On some days they have where they will let you feed big Koi fish

very attractive spot in Kelaniya,various fish types can see,very interesting to go with kids,mind relaxing with fish watching,beautiful fish are there,very much colourfull,feel amazing about the  nature creations,
Great place to visit.most of the species are genuine. Species inherent to sri Lanka are there.also foreign species.

What an experience leaned a lot.. as a fish lover there are so many different  rare fish and coral exhibits on display and well kept clean and well maintain tanks and bird cages lots of space well educated notes taking helpful staff Highly recommend for students who interested in Marine biology and of course fish lovers üëçüòç

I didnt expect it to be such a big park and to see such large number of fish and bird varieties there and from that point the park is fantastic to spend time. It cost Rs. 320 for adult and Rs. 220 for kid aged 3-11 years. It took 3 hr to 3.5 hrs to complete the experience and my kids were very happy. The place is not maintained properly. I feel fish tanks were not cleaned properly as the water quality of some of the tanks were very poor. The place need a upgrade immediately.
lovly palce to vist with your kids to learn about fish variations, nicely exhibited ans arranged. It will take more than 4hrs to complete the tour, Take your time and enjoy!

This place is located near by Kelaniya Temple. This place has Aquarium and Bird Park. There are different types of fish categories are available at here. I was wondering about the variety of it. Very good and somewhat maintain well. I recommend you to visit there.

Water World Lanka was fantastic. The number of tanks alone is staggering, and the fish are in good shape, and (usually) quite a bit more mature than most other aquariums we have visited. Most of the exhibits are in tunnels, well shielded from the hot sun. A couple notes: 1.) Like most such attractions we ran into in Sri Lanka, there is no place really to eat here. There is a small snack bar, but the fare is pretty limited.  2.) There is no wifi... anywhere.  3.) Be sure to have a ride back, especially if you are staying in Colombo. There are plenty of tuk tuks, and a bus depot accross the street, but we had difficulty finding a way back to our hotel. Thankfully we found a friendly gentlemen willing to help us out.
Best collections from amazon river and other good collections also. Tunnel Aquarium is at expected level.
Good place for kids and also if you like to know about various species of fish and birds.Double the rate (LKR.600/-) if you are a foreigner.

I went there with my family and it was a great Experience. Clean environment and worth for every penny spent. Internal cafe Was also good enough. Really recommend it to any local or tourists. Cheers !!! üòäü§ìüíû
We visited last month and enjoy and study in world and Sri Lanka fish birds . thanks for water world this project very well adults and children . for we are lucky Sri Lanka people s in the world.
It was a very good experience to watch the sea life in sri lanka . Entrance prices are cheap and can spent 2-3 hours. Few things to improve , such as clean toilets and good cafeteria.

I visited water world accompanied by family including a few youngsters aged four and seven. Cutting to the chase; The visit was an exciting experience for the kids, while for the adults the diversity of aquatic life was sufficient to hold our interest. There is also a bird park which is smaller in comparison but is still worth a mention. The fish and the birds are kept in very small, cramped enclosures which is reminiscent of the Dehiwala zoo and I felt uneasy at times as we progressed through the exhibits (which in a few instances were in a dilapidated condition). I would sincerely request the management to look at a facelift for the park while also looking at reducing the specimens carried in each enclosure as it was sad to see so many animals cramped into very small spaces. This is not bad place for a field trip, or a one time visit. There are very interesting sites which must be seen. That being said I am unlikely to visit again.
There are lot of new fishes from deep sea in all over world and birds. In every tank They have written about the fish in English and Sinhala languages.
This is a good place to see animals & fish. Children love this place & unexpectedly  a good place to visit for an outing.

The place is very nice with variation of fish, birds and other animals as well. It's so nice to have evening walk through the canels and the area. The bad experience was they don't have a place to buy lunch but you can bring lunch from out side and have it there. They have a small canteen which you can order drinks. They maintain it well.
Guite nice place..plenty local children visered same time there...Cleanliness was not the best ...but quite normal at Sri LankaüòÄstyle...

I've been to several aquariums and this is one of the best! LOTS of varieties of fish - perhaps a hundred - and lots of care to explain each of them. The experience is great - tunnels, good railings and lighting. The underwater tunnel is a lovely - if short - attraction. The entry fee is close to nothing. So while it's a bit of a bother getting all the way here, it's certainly worth it. Highly recommended.

A place I did not know existed & for sure took me by surprise !!! Your kids will love it. The place needs more advertising/publicity. Many kinds of fish and birds. They even have a specific time they feed the fish and you can see this when you walk through the tunnel. No doubt this has to be the best aquarium in the country. Well maintained & not much of crowd. (I believe this is due to the lack of publicity) A good place for a family outing specially for the kids. But that doesn't mean the adults will not enjoy :)
Kids can enjoy lot here with looking different kind of fishes. the fishes who are in cartoons and book covers can see here.

This place is not a super attractive place. But compared to all the aquarium in the country this is the best. If I was not mistaken there are not much aquarium tunnels present in south Asia and this is unique to them. A good outing with the family.
kids will love this place. worth the visit. good holiday attraction. close to colombo and on holydays crowd is more.
since sri lanka doesn't have large scale aquariums i suggest waterworld is the best place, they have somewhat big collection of fish and birds,

After coming to sri lanka  yearly for the last ten years,  A friend suggested we come here for the day. it is so worth the visit. I was impressed! there are many type of fish and also a large variety of birds.  there are benches through out the park and also a small playground.  it took us about three hours to explore this nice park. cost as of yesterday visit. Foreign ticket is rs 600 and local is rs 280.

This is my 1st time visit under water tunnel and it was in Sri Lanka. The place is close to Colombo, 20mins by train from colombo fort, ticket price is LKR 10 per person. Once you reach kelaniya station, u can get tuk-tuk or bajaj to drop you to water world LKR100. Entrance ticket is LKR 280 (include bird watching) the ticket quite law because I have resident visa üòä The area very clean and all staff friendly also helpful. 1 suggestion, need to take care the animals more, because i can see some of them are tired and old The opening hours is 9.30am to 5pm. You can get there from Colombo by taxi, however it is take 1 hour without traffic
We visited Water World Last week with my kids, they love that place. Nice collection of Fish around the world. Well maintained and some construction still going on birds section.

very clean place to visit with family to enjoy the nature and see the fish. it offers large number of fish and small number of birds in the location. its a small distance from the highway and from kelaniya temple
Good place to visit with childrens  - Young or Small - They defenetly love it. Can spend hours with no Fuss!.
So many water species and birds are available to view .Some times fish are not seen inside the under water tunnel .pretty hot out there as well.

We visited this place with kids and witnessed various kinds of fish and animals here. This is a good place to go with your friends and family. They have given a good description about all animals that they have with the history of them.
We could see some fish and exotic birds. The place was small and was not maintained properly could be seen. I hope now it would be maintained properly. There's no much variety of birds and fish.
Nice and clean place,both water park and birds park.But gets crowded in weekends.If visiting as a family or friends better pack lunches.Water tunnel is a good attraction.

its a good place. nice water park in south asian standard. but they have 2 typs of ticket. and the ticket price for the foreigners is very high. i was really surprised seeing such ticket rate almost all over in SL.

The place was reasonably good if you are a Sri Lankan and have never visited will never have the chance to visit such a place in a developed country. This is not up to the mark compared to the ones I have visited in Japan. But, there were some interesting fish, which are indigenous to Sri Lanka and also dangerous to Sri Lanka. Also, lots of fish from the Amazon river also! So if you are eager to know about them and see them, this is the place to go, specially if you are a foreigner. There is a bird park too. Good for children. Prices for locals were: Rs. 280 for adults and Rs. 180 for children. As I can remember, price for a foreign adult was around Rs. 400.

Visited this place on a sunday morning. It was moderately crowded. They have a small car park but this may not be sufficient for long. There were no queues and it was easy to get in. Ticket is a little pricier than accustomed to, but nothing too expensive. The place is fairly well laid out, ensuring you do not miss anything. There are signs, and descriptions next to the exhibits, however the descriptions are not consistent in that some exhibits do not have descriptions, while others have extremely interesting to read and detailed ones, with highlights of the species, and indicates if it is something exhibited for the first time in Sri Lanka, hybrid species, etc... There is a very large variety of fish and birds on display here, and some very stunning exhibits. They also have a small (10meter) underwater tunnel with a moving walkway, which is a first for Sri Lanka and despite the small size, they should be given a special mention for building and operating it. While a decent effort, the entire place gives off that "almost there at International levels but not quite" vibe. With a little finishing work done, such as better descriptions on the animals, it could be a star attraction. The biggest disappointment has to be the shark tank; all the sharks were very small ones (maybe less than 3 feet length). The best part has to be the birds on exhibit; there is a wide variety of colourful birds that will delight all ages. It should also be noted that this place does not appear to be disabled friendly: floor levels are uneven, there are stairs to be navigated, and in the fish tanks area there is very almost no lighting at floor level. Cleanliness is decent.

Water world Kelaniya.. This water park is well kept in as much as safety and cleanliness. The attractions are averagely amazing. Although quite expensive and I recomend to arrive early on a sunny day, it could mark a highlight on any kid's (or adult's) visit.. I proud that we Srilankan's have this kind of water parks... Thank you guys...!

This is near to kaduwela & Kalaniya temple. It's nice to see so many variations of fishes. It has one & only underwater tunnel in Sri Lanka, & really nice, but it was 30 feet long. :( This place has not only fish but also many variety of birds.  It was a great experience.. :)

This is a follow up review from six months ago. This is an attraction that we visit once a month, and it continues to sustain our toddler's interest. A possible improvement would be introducing a feeding pool so children can see the fish eating; and developing the play area so kids have more to do.

We went to this place on a weekend. Place was overcrowded... All the vehicle parks were full and we had to wait in que for sometime in the hot sun. Once we entered from the gates, we had to stay in line to go through the tunnels with a huge crowd where there were no lights or ventilation... It was suffocating.... We just wanted to get-out through the tunnels.... It was a bad experience for us. The birds were kept in too small cages.... There were not enough spaces for some of the birds to fly freely.... It was such a sad sight.... Will never go there again...

It's nice to see so many variations of fishes. The pathways needs to a bit lit as it was pitch dark inside the tunnels.. I was heading with full hope to see the underwater tunnel, but it was mere 30 feet long and walk within the tunnel lasted only for a few minutes... Was a great experience though.. Saw so many sea creatures we never even heard of..
Went with some friends, average place for fun but a good place for education. No high class facilities but the place is clean and well maintained.

The places ok for an evening / for children. the tickets includes access for fish section and bird park. The fish section is good but the bird park is small and some variety of birds and cages single. The charges are higher compared to the ticket price of Colombo Zoo. You have nothing to do beyond two hours, unless you want to study about each varieties of fish they have. The under water section is ver small, but that is the only place contains under water view in Sri Lanka. Very poor facilities for parking, but you can park along the road / neighboring lands, but thy too charge 150 rupees for one or two hours. They do have a website which provides some essential informations.

We take our daughter here frequently. This is a facility with aquariums and birds. It does not include any water play. The park is clean and well maintained although you need to go early because parking is limited. It has long cool passageways with aquariums which are engaging and educational; the bird park has room for improvement, but includes a decent range to keep you occupied. There is a playground which provides some distraction for children; and the underwater passageway, although small, is a major hit. There is a kiosk that sells food and beverages and aside from the beverages we would advise you to bring your own food if you intend to have lunch. The entrance fee is reasonable for locals and foreigners alike.

I went with my family and friends to this aquarium and bird sanctuary near Kelaniya temple which was one the places visited by Lord Buddha on his visit to Sri Lanka. There was quite a variety of fish from jelly fish to many others. There was no guide available and website says educational tours are available. Some information was provided in multiple languages nearby. Water tunnel was too short, 30 feet long, but you can repeatedly go through it. Limited types of fish were there in the tunnel. Bird Park is also worth to visit, next to the water world. However, through half inch wire mesh it was really hard to see the beauty of birds. I couldn‚Äôt capture at least one bird in the park. One reason would be that to stop feeding by visitors. Limited parking facilities and I didn‚Äôt see enough security provided by the management. Cafeteria running understaff with limited choices. If you are going with kids better well prepared.

I went with 20 adults, teens, young children, and babies to this aquarium and bird sanctuary. There is quite a variety of fish from sea horses to sharks. A relatively new and probably the best exhibit is the aquarium tunnel. The kids went through that repeatedly. There are playgrounds and many shady spots. The bird sanctuary is large and houses a worldly collection. Last, there is a paddle boat in a small man made lake; stand in line; 2 people at a time. Adult admission 450 LKR if I remember correctly.

It's website does not do justice to the actual location, its exhibits are interesting, however the pathways around the aquariums need to be better illuminated. I hope that the management betters the environs of this place if they want to attract more visitors.

Actually a great place for kids and adults too. Especially the Underwater world is amazing, similar to Singapore but we must proud that we have it here!!! Really my son enjoyed hence he is SHARK fan. We may come again with many kids and their families too.

Beautiful collection of fish in reasonably well maintained aquarium. Newly added tunnel so miniature and so little fish.No where near international standards. Adjoining bird wold kills the beauty of the birds due to half inch wire mesh fixed at every cage from largest bird to smallest. cafeteria is much to desired and understaffed

Went to see this place with family members. Even though they have advertised it is the first and the biggest underwater tunnel in South Asia, this tunnel is very short. The water above on this tunnel is very shallow. You can see few small fish only there and the tunnel is built on the soil and not under water. Since there is an electric walk track, you cannot wait or stop inside the tunnel. But you can go on that any number of times. Since that was a slightly rainy day, we were on trouble due to that. No proper car parking. The car park was full on that day. Then we decided to park in the private land which is near that and had to pay Rs.100 for parking. Bird Park has a large and rare collection of birds when compared to Dehiwala Zoo. But the bird cages are poorly built with 2 layers where it is quite hard to see the bird inside properly. Water world has a large collection of fish. Best place for kids. Also there was only 1 small cafeteria inside with nothing much to eat or drink. This place is better to avoid on weekends/holidays and rainy days as it can be crowded and parking can be difficult.

Visited recently with friends. Less than an hour journey by motor bike. Situated near Kelaniya vihara and in biyagama road. It is a good place to visit with children.  An hour or two can be spent there. My personal humble  suggestion is that maintenance and the categories of fish can be improved or increased.....

Visited water world with friends in January 2014 after a short journey from Negombo, it was not quite what I expected, I had wanted to see & hear a it more about the marine life on display. The fish & aquatic creatures where kept in large enough tanks, some information was provided in several languages outside the tanks, there was no guide or tour available despite the website saying there were 'educational tours available'. The last few meters you step onto a moving walkway and within fifteen seconds if you are not careful you have to step off it's so short. Worth it if you want to amuse the children for a few hours. Next door is a park for birds which is also worth a visit.

Bit of a drive from Colombo but the diverse range of marine and bird life make up for it. The place exhibits many species of rare aquatic creatures (mainly fish) and some beautiful (caged) birds in their bird park. The entrance fee of LKR 280 per adult didn't seem a rip-off. The music blaring at the entrance was very disturbing but thankfully it faded away as we moved along. The tunnel (apparently the first in south-asia) is short. The water above it is very shallow so you won't find any big fish you find in Singapore or Dubai. This somewhat renders the tunnel useless. This place is best avoided on weekends and holidays as it can get crowded and parking can be an ordeal.

I took my family (wife and 2 kids below 7) in June 2013. This is a 2-in-1 facility / attraction. Water World and Birds park. We have visited many aquariums and Bird Parks around the world. However, in Sri lankan context, this place need very special appreciation. Lots of efforts and energy has gone in to produce such an outstanding facility. We were amazed how this was maintained and kept tidy! This is commendable! Kids enjoyed thoroughly. Water world has a great variety of fish from various parts of the world. You can experience the first ‚ÄúUnder Water Tunnel Aquarium‚Äù in South Asia. Its a lovely experience. Very reasonably priced attarction, popular among locals and tourist. Bird park has many variety of birds from different origins and a pair of most expensive macav too. Request every body to help keep this attarction clean and tidy. Distances: Airport to Water World: approx 45 minutes, Colombo  to Water World: approx 30 to 45 minutes

Well why i called this journey as a short distnace ancient spirit is....Kelaniya temple is one of the 12 places visit by Lord Budha on his visit to Sri lanka. And its so much worshipped by local and forign Bhuddists all over the world. Kelaniya is only a short distance from Colombo. Less than an hours drive. The arts and the structure the sthoopa is made is quite unique compaired to other temples. It is said that the sthoopa is built tresuring the golden chair which was offered to Lord Budha to preech to the King who reighned Keleniya at that time. Best days to visit the temple is on poya days to see how much people devote. And theres free food.

This could be a new & great experience to majority of Sri Lankans who are unable to travel outside the country to enjoy such an attraction specially for an affordable price. Kids would love the place & no other place gives such an experience of an aquarium in the country. The idea of Underwater tunnel should be commended. However the parking facilities are very poor & no security at all. You may have to be extra cautious specially for your kids as well as your vehicle. Dining facilities specially for visiting school children should be improved a lot with a well arranged Cafeteria. It will helpful to improve the cleanliness too. The Under Water Tunnel should have been longer for better experience & filled with more species. More attention should be given to the cleanliness. Anyway comparing to a country where such a modern way of enjoyment facilities are limited the idea of the Water World Lanka & the effort should be highly appreciated.
One of the nice aquariums in the country situated in Kelaniya. It has over 500 varieties of fish and the place is very famous among children.

This will be new experience to you if you not have visited to any other overseas countries that has the real underwater world!! to spend a weekend day with your friends or family this will be Average rated place! and they have considerable amount of water spies and Birds in bird world!! Price is 280 per adult and 140 for children! Nevertheless, I was disappointed after visiting to water Wolrd lanka! once i see the place. On rainy day you will feel sorry for you! since there is proper shelters! and there is no good cafeteria as well!

It was nice experience but I can tell visit it when you have free time in Colombo. Price for non-lanka people is 400 rupies per person. Where I see the problem is very small parking and very poor selection in caffeteria. The size of attraction is good but I though that Underwater tunnel will be bigger. I was there for 1,5 hours and it is enough.

It's easy to citisize but the owner has made a tremendous effort all of his own to offer something unique to the general public , the majority who cannot travel abroad. In any country the national zoo must take the lead but here it's another story. Ddirector after Ddirector who was appointed to the national zoo ruined the place. Today Dehiwela is a concrete jungle. At least this man has wide experience in Aqua culture and avi culture and he has made a good effort. We need to encourage such people not discourage.

There are three ways to look in to this place as per March 2013. [1] Form the eye of a local who, have not experienced a popular aquarium in a foreign country. [2] From the eye of a person who has been to at least one of the popular foreign aquariums , but still want to spend some time in a local aquarium with friends, kids and family. [3] from the eye of a person who is looking for a world class aquarium to visit. I recommend this place to the first two group of people. When compared to the other aquariums in Sri Lanaka, I believe this place is well maintained.(More to improve of course). The displays are well maintained, informative and spacious. The tour is worth for the amount we pay. I went with few friends and few kids aging around 5 years. They had a nice time there. The under water tunnel they market these days (2013) is well set up and I believe this is a good achievement in the Sri Lnakan  context. The tunnel is 30 feet long and the setup has well established with standards. There is a large play area with loads of play equipment. Overall, this is a great experience for the locals who do not have  the luxury of traveling abroad. There are many points to improve: As tharinduc mentioned [1] First place limited Car parking. management should look in to this seriously. There are few adjoining land plots converted in to car parks by neighbors and started a business there. But I recommend this should be organised, otherwise this will become a mafia. [2] Overall the pace get hot when its around noon, mainly because the concrete structures. Air conditioning will not be a feasible option. But spraying cool water in places can be done. [3] The Bird cages are double meshed , making it hard to see the birds. Sometimes its necessary to protect birds from crazy visitors. But this needs to be addressed without comprising the main course of displaying the birds. [4] The only canteen is not sufficient when the place is crowded. The management should set up a good canteen and a souvenir shop. Overall, This is a good place for a local who want to witness a good aquarium or want to spend few hours with your loved ones showing them some beautiful fish and birds. If you are a traveler who already have experienced aquariums abroad or want to experience a world class aquarium, this may not be the place for you. Hope the management improve the place to give a convenient  experience to visitors.

Went to see this place today as they were advertising mentioning as the first underwater tunnel in South Asia. But we were really disappointed after going to the place. Quality of the place is no way near to the quality you get in other countries. Price is reasonable, 280Rs for a local adult for both water world and bird park and it is 400Rs for a foreign adult. First of all, no proper car parking. There is a small car park which is full. Then we had to wait in queue for 30 minutes as it's a holiday. The queue is poorly managed and people have to stand in sun for long to get a ticket. At least a shade should be built. We got tickets to both the bird park and water world. Bird park has a larger and expensive collection of birds when compared to Dehiwala zoo. But the bird cages are poorly built with 2 layers where it is quite hard to see the bird inside. Many birds caged alone in small cages making us sad about the creature inside. Water world has a large collection of fish. Again it's quite hot inside the tunnels making us very uncomfortable. There was a tiny piece of tunnel called under water tunnel, but it's nothing much to see really as it's a poorly built mini tunnel about 15 feet in length. You can only see few small fish there and the tunnel is built on the soil and not under water. Also there was only 1 small cafeteria inside with nothing much to eat or drink. Overall, if you are a tourist, avoid this place at all costs. If you are a local and have not traveled abroad, this maybe something to amuse you. Hope things will improve later with the large amount of money they draw from ticket sales.
